CatDescriptText: Rachealle Furches, barber, 6836 Frankstown Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 10, 1959, pg. 6 with question: "With Mayor Lawrence performing his duties as Governor in Harrisburg, do you believe the Democratic party in Pittsburgh will be weakened by his absence?" answer reads: "No.  I don't think so.  He had a pretty nice staff when he was here and everybody helped.  If everybody in Democratic party continues to work for the good of the people, then they will be successful."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Rachealle Furches, wearing eyeglasses, earrings, dark sweater, light colored jacket with floral lace handkerchief in left breast pocket, and dark coat with striped lining, standing in front of brick wall, and window with floral curtains
